Data: Bollinger to de Kock, 1 wide left-arm over the wicket, starts on a shortish length but this slides down the leg side
Bollinger to de Kock, no run on line this time, de Kock hops back and defends from the crease

Bollinger to de Kock, OUT got him, extra pace and bounce and de Kock feathers through to Dunk! Nothing stroke from de Kock, just hung his bat out - but the ball fair zipped through off the surface, seamed a fraction, took a small but visible deflection off the edge and South Africa are one down
Bollinger to Rossouw, no run back of a length, shuffles across and defends safely down on to the pitch

Bollinger to Rossouw, no run Bollinger is hammering in, hitting the deck hard and this flies through above shoulder height as Rossouw swats wildly at it - Dougie thought there may have been some glove involved, but no. Took a superb leap from Dunk to snag it

Bollinger to Rossouw, FOUR runs lofted straight down the ground, four more! Length ball from Bollinger and although Rossouw swung across the line, he managed to bisect mid-on and mid-off with a leading edge and again the ball scoots away
Faulkner to Hendricks, no run pitched up from over the wicket, around off stump, watchfully defended by Hendricks
Faulkner to Hendricks, 1 run full and straight, this is clipped of the pads through square for a single
Faulkner to Rossouw, no run slightly back of a length, moves across outside off and taps back down the pitch
Faulkner to Rossouw, no run good lines from Faulkner, not offering any width, again Rossouw defends from the crease
Faulkner to Rossouw, FOUR runs brutal! Nothing wrong with this ball from Faulkner, on a good length, off-stump line but Rossouw whips his hands across the line and crunches four to deep midwicket

Faulkner to Rossouw, OUT got him, slower ball and this time the leading edge is snaffled by Faulkner! He's a canny lad in this form of the game, Faulkner, although his back-of-the-hand delivery was heading down the leg side. Rossouw was done by the lack of pace, heaved to leg again, the edge ballooned back down the pitch and the bowler clutched it diving to his right
Bollinger to Hendricks, no run angled across the right-hander, who sits back and steers the ball to backward point on the bounce
Bollinger to Hendricks, no run on the stumps, Hendricks defends this time
Bollinger to Hendricks, 1 run shortish, Hendricks rocks back and clothes a pull down towards fine leg for one
Bollinger to Duminy, no run good length, 138kph on off stump, presents a straight bat coming forwards
Bollinger to Duminy, no run this flies through again from Bollinger, cuts Duminy in half as he tries to paddle across the line
Bollinger to Duminy, 1 run squares him up slightly, staying on the back foot, Duminy manages to control an outside edge through gully for a single to get off the mark
Faulkner to Duminy, no run bounds in, length ball around off stump, watchfully played into the off side
Faulkner to Duminy, no run length delivery, Duminy comes forward on off stump, tapped into the covers
Faulkner to Duminy, 1 run pitched up, tempting the drive and Duminy gets a low edge, falls short of keeper and slip... in fact, it bobbles between them and they pinch one

Faulkner to Hendricks, 1 run chipped back towards mid-off on the bounce and Hendricks takes on the arm, not sure who the fielder was but the throw missed with all three stumps to hit. Actually, Hendricks was in anyway
Faulkner to Duminy, 1 run on the stumps, worked into a gap in the leg side for one
Faulkner to Hendricks, no run good length, straightens a touch off the angle, Hendricks is hit on the padding and Faulkner asks the questions - possibly too high
Abbott to Duminy, FOUR runs bit of width, Duminy rattles the hands through a rapier cut stroke and the ball flashes to the boundary
Abbott to Duminy, no run swing and miss this time, little bit of extra bounce for Abbott and the ball zips through
Abbott to Duminy, 1 run on the stumps, worked across the line to the leg side for another quick single
Abbott to Hendricks, no run good lines, Hendricks is struggling to work the ball around here, blocked back down the pitch

Abbott to Hendricks, FOUR runs oh, me and my mouth... this is crumped through midwicket, who could smell the freshly mown hay, that was so agricultural but it brings Hendricks four, shuffling back and roundhousing four
Abbott to Hendricks, 1 run straight lines and Hendricks shovels one more to the leg side
Bollinger to Hendricks, no run over the wicket and sliding across, defended coming forwards
Bollinger to Hendricks, no run pitched up, Hendricks drives, a bump ball into the hands of Bollinger as he follows through
Bollinger to Hendricks, 1 run short of a length, Hendricks is quickly on to it, swivel-pulls in the air towards deep backward square, who takes it on the bounce
Bollinger to Duminy, 1 run fuller and sliding on to the pads, Duminyn nibbles one more through backward square
Bollinger to Hendricks, 1 run good length on middle and leg, closes the face and works into a gap at midwicket, Maxwell scampers across to keep them to a single
Bollinger to Duminy, FOUR runs lovely stroke from JP, leans into a slightly overpitched delivery and spanks it straight back down the ground for four
Maxwell to Hendricks, FOUR runs starts around the wicket, full and outside off and Hendricks drives, gets a thick edge wide of the keeper for a couple
Maxwell to Hendricks, 1 run tossed up, drifting across the right-hander, who plinks one into a gap at cover
Maxwell to Duminy, 1 run flat trajectory, on middle and off stump, Duminy begins to close the face and gets a leading edge through mid-off
Maxwell to Hendricks, no run pushes this through a bit quicker, extra bounce beats the bat as Hendricks chops at it
Maxwell to Hendricks, no run floated up on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
Maxwell to Hendricks, 2 runs worked away into the leg side and for a minute it looks as they might struggle for a second but Hendricks whirs back and makes his ground comfortably in the end
Cummins to Duminy, no run starts on a decent length, around off stump, Duminy plays it carefully back
Cummins to Duminy, no run shorter length, 136kph and Duminy has to hop back and get his bat behind it
Cummins to Duminy, no run short again, width encourages Duminy to have a dip, 139kph delivery flies through past the flailing bat edge
Cummins to Duminy, no run short again and climbing, this time he crouches out of harm's way
Cummins to Duminy, no run shortish, outside off, chopped into the ground straight to backward point

Cummins to Duminy, no run pitched up a fraction wide, Duminy reaches for the drive and finds the diving Maxwell equal to it at backward point again - a precious maiden for Postman Pat, who delivers again
Faulkner to Duminy, 1 run steps to leg and shovels through midwicket as Faulkner follows him with the ball
Faulkner to Miller, 1 run pitched up on middle and leg, flicked fine but they don't manage a second, think Miller slipped when turning
Faulkner to Duminy, SIX runs fetch that! Length ball from Faulkner and Duminy finally sends one over the ropes, meaty swing to leg and the ball sailed h-i-i-i-i-i-g-h over deep square leg
Faulkner to Duminy, 1 run slightly shorter, goes for the pull to leg again, gets a single to long-on
Faulkner to Miller, FOUR runs sliced and beyond the fingertips of backward point! Miller threw the hands at that, just managed to clear the man and it runs away for four

Faulkner to Miller, OUT scooped high into the leg side, there's a man under this... gottim! Miller's time is up, aiming for the same boundary that Duminy cleared a few balls ago, got under it but didn't have the distance, taken comfortably a few yards in from the fence
Cummins to McLaren, 1 run length ball, little bit of width and McLaren swings hard, gets a thick edge down to third man
Cummins to Duminy, 1 run short and swatted through midwicket for another single
Cummins to McLaren, no run slightly back of a length outside off stump, attempted steer to third man misses out
Cummins to McLaren, no run another feisty bumper, McLaren had enough of those from Mitch Johnson earlier this year and sensibly ducks

Cummins to McLaren, OUT another short ball, McLaren takes this one... and top edges to fine leg running in! This is pretty ordinary from South Africa, they're now six down and Cummins has the wicket he deserves. Dug in and angled across, McLaren was never in control of the shot and Faulkner hared in to take a good catch
Cummins to Duminy, 1 run touch short of a length, runs a single to third man
Boyce to Hendricks, no run lovely delivery to begin with, flighted and straightening to slip past the outside edge as Hendricks plays forward
Boyce to Hendricks, 1 run a touch straighter, Henricks waits on it and pushes a single into the leg side
Boyce to Duminy, 1 run tossed up on the stumps, leans over the ball and flicks to the leg side

Boyce to Hendricks, OUT done him, Hendricks is down the river and stumped without a paddle! Superb work from Boyce, lured the batsman out but the ball dipped and he was nowhere near the pitch, just enough spin to go past the outside edge and he had no chance of regaining his ground

Boyce to Behardien, no run flighted, nice and straight, clumped towards mid-on and there's all sorts going on here! The ball bounces short of Faulkner but he snatches it and fires off a throw, Duminy is way down the pitch... but Boyce tries to deflect the ball on to the stumps first time, rather than collect it, which he had time to do
Boyce to Behardien, 1 run tossed up outside off stump and pushed into the covers for a single
Cummins to Behardien, 1 run fullish line on off stump, turned through the leg side for a single
Cummins to Duminy, 1 run back of a length, goes across and runs the ball down to third man
Cummins to Behardien, 1 run full again, not quite yorker length, punched towards mid-on for another single
Cummins to Duminy, 1 run short of a length and pushed across the left-hander, Duminy gets on top of it and steers through point
Cummins to Behardien, no run sharp bouncer, at the batsman, who takes evasive action
Cummins to Behardien, no run Behardien is done for pace here, the ball coming on at a clip and deflecting off the thigh pad behind square
Faulkner to Duminy, 2 runs pitched up, nicely timed back down the ground and they get two as long-on jogs across to cut it off
Faulkner to Duminy, no run advances, length ball from Faulkner, maybe a change of pace and Duminy misses heaving across the line
Faulkner to Duminy, 2 runs on the stumps, squeezes one out into the leg side

Faulkner to Duminy, OUT Duminy hoicks a fullish ball high towards wide long-off - but it's taken on the run by Finch! The Aussies are waltzing here, they've nipped out the SA captain and still the score is below 100. The umpires checked for the no-ball but he had a smidge of rubber behind the line
Faulkner to Parnell, no run takes the pace off, outside the line of off stump, bottom-edged through to the keeper
Faulkner to Parnell, no run back of a length, again can't get it away
Cummins to Abbott, 1 run good pace from Cummins, an inside edge deflects on to the pads, they steal one as the bowler pounds down the pitch in his follow through
Cummins to Parnell, no run excellent bouncer from Cummins, again Parnell swipes at thin air
Cummins to Parnell, no run back of a length, flying through over the stumps, Parnell leans back and fails to connect
Cummins to Parnell, 1 run slower ball from Cummins this time, room for Parnell to swing the arms, chops one through mid-off

Cummins to Abbott, 1 run length ball on middle stump, Abbott drives off the back foot, Cameron White picks it up to his left at extra cover, swivels and throws... a direct hit would do it but the ball bounces safely by. That's the Saffer 100 up
Cummins to Parnell, 1 run in the blockhole and Parnell manages to club another single back past the bowler - Cummins and Australia won't mind that, they've managed to limit South Africa to just 101
If you're African, it's been a grim hour or so, as Zimbabwe managed to toss away the second Test against Bangladesh too. Anyway, I'll be back in 15... Don't go anywhere.

9.05pm: Well, just the ten boundaries tells most of the story for South Africa, who have lurched back into familiar territory when it comes to T20 in Oz. They'll want to put that performance in Room 101, though Cummins and Boyce, in particular, bowled superbly. SA will have to supersize their bowling effort from Adelaide if they're going to match that maiden victory and clinch the series - however, only once has a team defended a lower score than 101 from
Kyle Abbott again leads the visiting attack... And it is indeed Ben Dunk to open with Finch
Abbott to Dunk, no run steams in, hits the pitch hard back of a length, Dunk blocks safely from the crease
Abbott to Dunk, no run gets on top of the bounce and drives firmly, picks out mid-off
Abbott to Dunk, no run excellent bumper from Abbott, only slightly short but it rears at Dunk, who dunks his head down out of the line
Abbott to Dunk, no run length delivery, this is a little wide but Dunk misses out, flails around the delivery as it flies through
Abbott to Dunk, 3 runs overpitched, in the channel, connects this time and drills three through cover point, opened the face nicely
Abbott to Finch, no run length ball, skids on a touch and nearly catches out Finch, who turns the ball softly to leg
Rabada to Dunk, no run good length and a teasing line outside off, crackles to life off the pitch and flies through to the keeper - excellent start
Rabada to Dunk, no run fuller and straighter, tapped back to the bowler
Rabada to Dunk, FOUR runs flashed and flashed hard, over the leap of Behardien at cover-point, given a bit of width and Dunk thrashed a short ball over the infield
Rabada to Dunk, FOUR runs too full this time and rasped down the ground, lovely shape on the drive and that's four more
Rabada to Dunk, 1 run good length, 141 clicks and it squirts off the outside edge as Dunk pushes forwards, single to third man
Rabada to Finch, 1 wide slides down the leg side - 145kph, fast but wayward
Rabada to Finch, no run banged in very short, veering towards the leg side again, Finch offers nothing and Rabada gets away with it
Abbott to Dunk, 3 runs Dunk skips out on the attack, gets the toe end of the bat but manages to lift it through the covers for three more
Abbott to Finch, 1 wide back of a length and sprayed down the leg side - SA have already given up more extras than Australia
Abbott to Finch, no run stays back in the crease and pats a shortish ball towards mid-on
Abbott to Finch, FOUR runs that's meat and drink for Finch, short and clubbed powerfully through backward square for his first boundary
Abbott to Finch, FOUR runs Abbott feeds the beats again, half-track at the body and Finch muscles it away to the same part of the ground for another four
Abbott to Finch, 1 run redirects his line, short of a length in the channel, punched into a gap at cover, through Parnell fields well to keep them to a single
Abbott to Dunk, 1 run angled across the lefty, opens the face and squirts one through the gully
Duminy to Dunk, no run length ball on off stump, Dunk reaches out and pushes into the covers
Duminy to Dunk, no run ooh, lovely delivery, tossed up and dipping as Dunk tries to work to leg, spins past the outside edge
Duminy to Dunk, 1 run uses the feet, full ball drifting towards leg stump, clubs one to long-on
Duminy to Finch, FOUR runs oof, not so good, low full toss to Finch who bludgeons it to wide long-on in the manner of a man chopping down a tree
Duminy to Finch, FOUR runs flatter, on the stumps, crunched back down the ground again, not the cleanest strike but it beats a rather feeble effort from long-on running across
Duminy to Finch, no run flat again, straightening on the stumps, Finch backs away and chops into the off side
Parnell to Dunk, no run shortish and Dunk miscues a pull along the ground to midwicket
Parnell to Dunk, (no ball) FOUR runs bit of width, slashed and top-edged beyond the grasp of slip... it was a front-foot no-ball too. Never mind the wheels coming off, the axle is broken too
Parnell to Dunk, no run free hit for Dunk but it's well bowled by Parnell, right up on his toes and squeezed to mid-off
Parnell to Dunk, 2 runs whips this away through the leg side for a couple
Parnell to Watson, 1 run angled across from over the wicket, drops back and runs the ball behind square to get off the mark first ball
Parnell to Finch, no run tight line, Finch covers his stumps in defence
Tahir to Watson, no run spiders to the crease, fullish on leg stump, clipped straight to midwicket along the ground
Tahir to Watson, 1 wide floated up outside leg stump, Watto sweeps and misses and de Kock whips off the bails... Wide
Tahir to Watson, 1 run flat trajectory on middle and leg, punched down the ground to long-on
Tahir to Finch, FOUR runs full and straight and dealt with dismissively, Finch swivelling his bulk through a flat sweep to fine leg
Tahir to Finch, FOUR runs four more, bullied through midwicket this time, played with the turn for the googly and smashed it past the man in the deep
Tahir to Finch, no run on the stumps, worked to midwicket, can't get it through
Tahir to Finch, no run skids on and tapped back to the on side
McLaren to Watson, FOUR runs short and wide and slapped through backward point for another boundary. South Africa are on the rocks, holed below the waterline
McLaren to Watson, no run pitched up, better line, Watson leans into a push
McLaren to Watson, FOUR runs punishing cover drive from Watto! He loves that shot, plants the front foot and brutalises a slightly full ball through the off side
McLaren to Watson, FOUR runs another boundary, Watto's rolling out the wagon wheel, feeble bouncer from McLaren and this is whipped through deep midwicket

McLaren to Watson, FOUR runs superb stroke, wattage from Watto, not a particularly bad ball this time but Watson had his weight back, rolled the arms through a beefy whack to the leg side, beats the fielder at deep square leg even though it was just a few yards to his left
McLaren to Watson, no run line and length, this time Watson respectfully defends back to the bowler
Tahir to Finch, 1 run regulation legspinner from Tahir, bit of width and Finch slices a drives short of point, only half fielded
Tahir to Watson, 1 run tossed up, Watson comes forward and spears one more to long-on
Tahir to Finch, FOUR runs gets down to sweep and the ball spins away from Rabada, who looks a bit dozy as he grabs thin air and the ball goes for four
Tahir to Finch, 1 run slightly wide and there's an anguished cry from the bowler as Finch chops one more in front of square
Tahir to Watson, no run mistimes a push back down the pitch
Tahir to Watson, 1 run tossed up, Watson isn't to the pitch and he top-edges an ungainly hoick... but it sails beyond the circle safely towards deep cover
Parnell to Watson, 2 runs short of a length, muscled on the pull into the deep and it's not fielded cleanly
Parnell to Watson, 1 run angled across in the channel, opens the face to guide one behind square
Parnell to Finch, 2 runs short ball and again pulled dismissively through the leg side for a couple more
Parnell to Finch, no run quicker and this bounces a touch more, Finch pulls and the ball deflects down on to the pitch
Parnell to Finch, 1 run swats this away through backward square leg for another single
Parnell to Watson, 1 run length ball, sprayed quite wide and Watson manages to toe end it into the covers for one more to the total
Rabada to Watson, 1 run length ball on middle and leg, flicked around the corner to the man on the rope
Rabada to Finch, 1 run shortish, outside off, sits in the crease and dabs one into the off side
Rabada to Watson, FOUR runs Watson is in clover here, Rabada pitches full on off stump and is dispatched lazily back down the ground, bounced a yard short of the long-on boundary
Rabada to Watson, 1 run on the stumps, worked away to leg for one more
Rabada to Finch, no run length on middle and leg, 139kph but it stops in the pitch slightly, loops short of mid-on
Rabada to Finch, no run well-directed short delivery, Finch rides the bounce and blocks short into the off side
Parnell to Watson, no run pitched up full and straight, Watson whips it off his toes to midwicket
Parnell to Watson, no run dug in very short and Watson elects to duck
Parnell to Watson, no run touch full, on middle stump and clubbed to the mid-on fielder
Parnell to Watson, no run short again, climbing rapidly through and this time Watson swings and misses
Parnell to Maxwell, no run good length on off stump, White opens the face and dabs in front of square but quickly nips back to his crease as the fielder homes in
Rabada to Finch, FOUR runs or maybe not... short of a length and straying to leg from Rabada, Finch only needs to get some bat on it and the ball races to long leg for four
Rabada to Finch, 2 runs fuller and on the stumps, nudged through square on the leg side for a couple
Rabada to Finch, no run length outside the line of off, tapped into the covers from the crease
Rabada to Finch, 1 run slightly full and clubbed back, Rabada sticks out a hand but can't snag it, bounces short of Duminy at mid-off, whose throw is errant
Rabada to Finch, 1 run length delivery, stays back and runs one behind square on the off side
Parnell to Finch, no run pushed back to the bowler
Parnell to Finch, 1 run back of a length, punched standing tall to mid-off and they scamper one to bring the scores level
Parnell to White, no run good length around the line of off, hits the outside half of the bat and rolls square
Parnell to White, 1 run shorter, White shovels a loopy top-edged pull wide of square leg, it falls safely and that is that - Australia win by seven wickets with plenty to spare
Australia won by 7 wickets (with 44 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Cameron Boyce, AUS
